text: feedback - While I agree there needs to be a 2 step process for deleting rows in hubDB. The dropdown for it on the id column being hidden by default causes confusion. I literally had a very tech savvy guy come up to me and go. “I don’t know how to delete a row.” It should be a 2 step process to delete to prevent accidents but it should be obvious how to do it.

Does anyone have an elegant solution to loading a different page based on location? The site in question is already built and using the smart content is not an option since that works with just a handful of fields like the rich text field which the website is using very few of them anyway. Any ideas?
There's a handful of variables like `request.geoip_city`, `request.geoip_country`, etc.  You could check against one of those and do a js redirect, maybe.
That’s better ... so then I don’t need to redirect :)
Hey Matt, did HubDB just get an update? I noticed a "publish"type button now in my HUBDB, whereas before simply navigating away from the field would save it and update to live...
Ok, so just noticed the v2 thing is live :slightly_smiling_face:
Woah had no idea about those
